org.overture.core.tests

Class ParamFineGrainTest<R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.overture.core.tests.AbsResultTest<R>
      • org.overture.core.tests.ParamFineGrainTest<R>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - the type of result this test operates on
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ParamExternalsTest

    public abstract class ParamFineGrainTest<R>
extends AbsResultTest<R>
    Test with fine grained parsing and type checking. This class is very similar to ParamStandardTest but it is capable of handling VDM sources that do not parse or type check correctly.

    The working principles behind this class are very similar to ParamStandardTest but you are responsible for calling the parser and type checker yourself.
    Author:
    ldc

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParamFineGrainTest

        public ParamFineGrainTest(String nameParameter,
                          String testParameter,
                          String resultParameter)
        Constructor simply passes parameters up to super class.
        Parameters:
        nameParameter - the name of the test. Usually derived from the VDM source
        testParameter - the path to the VDM source this test will run on
        resultParameter - the path to the stored result file

    • Method Detail

      • testCase

        public void testCase()
              throws ParserException,
                     LexException,
                     IOException
        The main test executor. Takes a VDM source (or any other text file) and processes it according to processSource(). It then reads a saved result via AbsResultTest.deSerializeResult(String). Finally, the two results are compared via AbsResultTest.compareResults(Object, Object).

        If the test is running in update mode, then no comparison will be made and the new result will be saved instead.
        Throws:
        IOException
        LexException
        ParserException

      • processSource

        public abstract R processSource()
        Process a VDM source (or any other text file) and do whatever. This method is called on the test input as part of the main test execution. It must return a result of type R.
        Returns:
        a test result of type R
